com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image
Class StandardImage

java.lang.Object
  com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.Image
      com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.StandardImage

public class StandardImage
extends Image

An image that stores the pixel values into a single double array in memory. Since images can get quite large and arrays are quite costly to create in Java, it is more desirable to use a single array.

The accessor functions then simply index to the correct position in the array to obtain the pixels we want.

The standard image always stores the underyling data in row-major order starting with the pixel at (0,0). In other words, an image with 3 bands would have the following in the beginning of the array:

(0,0,0) (0,0,1) (0,0,2) (1,0,0) (1,0,1) (1,0,2) (2,0,0) ...

Based on this, in order to get to a pixel at x,y,b we access the array index at: 


 index = x*numBands + y*width*numBands + b

And the total length of our double array will be: 


 length = width * height * numBands

Constructor Detail

StandardImage

public StandardImage(int width,
                     int height,
                     int numBands)
Creates a new image with the values array will be initialized to all 0's

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the image
height - The desired height of the image
numBands - The number of bands in the image

StandardImage

public StandardImage(int width,
                     int height,
                     int numBands,
                     double[] pixels)

Creates an image from existing values. This constructor does not copy the data passed in, but rather references it. This means that further modification to the data array will modify the image itself.

The pixels array must be of correct length (width * height * numBands) or an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the image
height - The desired height of the image
numBands - The number of bands in the image
pixels - The initial data for the image (must be in row-major order)

getPixels

public Iterable<Double> getPixels(Image.PixelOrder pixelOrder)
Description copied from class: Image
Returns an iterable of the pixels in the given row order. See the comments at the class level for more details on the pixel order. The pixel bands will be interleaved so for each pixel you will get each band and then you will get the next pixel. For example, in an RGB image the values will be R1B1G1R2B2...

Specified by:
getPixels in class Image
Returns:
An iterable of band-interleaved pixel values in the supplied order

getPixelWriter

public Sinkerator<Double> getPixelWriter(Image.PixelOrder pixelOrder)
Description copied from class: Image
Returns a iteratee which will allow you to write the pixel values out. Each call to putNext will replace the pixel value poitned at with the given value and move on to the next value.

Specified by:
getPixelWriter in class Image
Returns:
An iteratee of band-interleaved pixels that writes into the pixel values

doGet

public double doGet(int x,
                    int y,
                    int b)
Description copied from class: Image
Implemented by child classes to actually return the pixel value at the given coordinates. These coordinates are guaranteed to be >= 0 and <= width/height/numBands.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel
y - The y coordinate of the pixel
b - The band containing the desired pixel
Returns:
The value at that pixel
